item.title: R on Apple Silicon
item.description: Why Version control on R has always been a hassle for me personally since most of the bioinformatics tools or workflows relies too heavily on RMD or Notebook-like script due to its high flexibility. Despite its convenience in parameters tuning and data manipulation, it’s much more difficult than sharing the list of python packages in other workflows. Existing solution Someone used Anaconda environment file but I personally find that a bit too clumsy.
